title: How to Clean and Chop Haakh

steps.headline: Remove the string used to tie all the Haakh leaves.This can be done with hands or one might use scissors.
steps.description: Hold the string between the two tips of the fingers and rotate it in anti-clockwise direction.

steps.headline: Pick up each leaf.
Open each leaf and check to see whether there are any small insects present at the main node of the leaflet.
Remove pale yellow colored leaves from the rest of them.
Separate the leaf from the stalk.
Hold the leaf stem from the main one and pull it in the opposite direction from the main one.
Check for the presence of the fiber at the end of the stalk.
Pull it away and remove it.
Pull the fiber string 'till the end of the node.
See the fiber present at the stalk also and this also needs to be removed.
Remove the stalks which are thick ones.
Separate the leaves from the stems.
Break the stem into two parts.
Pull the outer layer of the stem slowly as this is not good for digestion.
Collect the leaves and stems.
Remove the yellow patched leaves.
Remove the thick stalks.
Check for the presence of the insects at the place where all the young leaves are collected together.
Remove the rotten leaves.
Place all the leaves in a vegetable basket.
